message.content: To answer this question, we need to consider basic knowledge about food safety and cooking methods. Option (A) of biting right into the fish raw is not recommended because it poses a risk of foodborne illnesses. Option (B) of holding the fish up to sunlight is not a proper cooking method and will not ensure the fish is safe to eat. Option (C) of putting the boot on a fire spit is unrelated to cooking the fish. Option (D) of striking flint over kindling and placing the fish above it is the correct choice because it suggests using a method of starting a fire and cooking the fish over it, which is a safe and effective way to cook the fish.

This question requires knowledge about cooking methods and food safety. Option (A) is incorrect because biting into raw fish can be unsafe as it may contain harmful bacteria or parasites that can cause foodborne illnesses. Option (B) is unrelated to cooking the fish and will not result in a cooked meal. Option (C) is also unrelated to cooking the fish and may damage the boot. Option (D) is the correct answer because it describes a method of starting a fire and cooking the fish over it. By striking flint over kindling, John can create sparks that will ignite the kindling, creating a fire. Placing the fish above the fire will allow it to cook and be safe to eat.
